title: Markus Eggler
text:
Markus Eggler (born 22 January 1969 in <a href="Thun">Thun</a>) is a retired <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> <a href="curling">curler</a> from <a href="M%C3%BCnchenstein">Münchenstein</a>.
Eggler was the skip of the Swiss team at the , and <a href="World%20Junior%20Curling%20Championships">World Junior Curling Championships</a>. At the event, he won a bronze medal. He then skipped the Swiss team at the <a href="World%20Curling%20Championships">World Curling Championships</a> in 1991, 1992 and 1994. He was the world champion in 1992 when his Swiss team defeated <a href="Hammy%20McMillan">Hammy McMillan</a>'s Scottish team in the final 6-3. Eggler won a bronze at the 1994 World Championships and a bronze at the <a href="1993%20European%20Curling%20Championships">1993 European Curling Championships</a>.
After 1994, Eggler would not return to international curling until 2000 when he played third for <a href="Andreas%20Schwaller">Andreas Schwaller</a> at the European Championships. At the <a href="2001%20World%20Curling%20Championships">2001 World Curling Championships</a>, he played lead for <a href="Christof%20Schwaller">Christof Schwaller</a> and won the silver medal. At the 2001 European Championships, he won a silver playing second for Andreas Schwaller. Still playing second for Schwaller, Eggler won a bronze medal at the 2002 Winter Olympics. Eggler continues to play second for Andreas.
Eggler announced his retirement from curling in 2010.
Teammates.
<a href="Curling%20at%20the%202010%20Winter%20Olympics">2010 Vancouver Olympic Games</a>
<a href="Ralph%20St%C3%B6ckli">Ralph Stöckli</a>, "Skip"
<a href="Jan%20Hauser">Jan Hauser</a>, "Third"
<a href="Simon%20Str%C3%BCbin">Simon Strübin</a>, "Lead"
<a href="Toni%20M%C3%BCller">Toni Müller</a>, "Alternate"
<a href="Curling%20at%20the%202002%20Winter%20Olympics">2002 Salt Lake City Olympic Games</a>
<a href="Andreas%20Schwaller">Andreas Schwaller</a>, "Skip"
<a href="Christof%20Schwaller">Christof Schwaller</a>, "Third"
<a href="Damian%20Grichting">Damian Grichting</a>, "Lead"
<a href="Marco%20Ramstein">Marco Ramstein</a>, "Alternate"
